intro: Psychotria paloensis var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its ovate, lanceolate leaves and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by various bird species. This plant is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
